channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Orange plastic netting, 11th August
item.description:
Plastic netting in the stream just below the Cloddymore railway footbridge.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Granley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Pothole Forming, 11th August
item.description:
A pothole is forming quickly on the M5 Southbound about 1/2 mile of Junction 10. There are others before it, but you can't miss this one as it's just on the driver side wheel and could be dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inactive roadworks - badly positioned., 10th August
item.description:
There has been a barrier up around a small road work in this location for well over a month, and no action. It is exactly where cars have to turn in from Hucclecote Road, which is very busy and also cars approaching the junction on Green Lane. This is an accident waiting to happen and the roadworks need to be completed as soon as possible. Yeah there has been no action for quite some time. I suggest that this is the remedied ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned untaxed and no mot car, 9th August
item.description:
It has been there for so long and is illegal

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Lansdown Crescent, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole outside no 33, 8th August
item.description:
Long-standing pothole - getting bigger and due to cars parked on other side of road you have to drive in it to pass safely and could cause damage to cars as gets bigger.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynmouth Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe pothole in lane 1 southbound carriageway, 8th August
item.description:
Significant pothole in lane 1 south. Driving car at 70mph, wrist injured as result of the force from wheel hitting pothole. Concerned may be damage to wheel/suspension as a result. I note this pothole was reported 13th July too. Your report says closed and that it would be investigated. I do not believe the issue has been remedied and at some point could result in an accident or significant damage.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is a 1/2 mile stretch where the road (as such as it is) is completely disintegrated., 8th August
item.description:
The road section has got progressively worse since the Spring but is a major cyclists route and as such is very dangerous. The whole route from Withington is deplorable and needs urgent attention
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Withington, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Foliage covering pavement, 8th August
item.description:
Hello Can someone please trim the trees bushes along the footpath by the river Chelt along honeybourne way. The footpath is almost obstructed in parts. Thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate on cycle route impassable on a cycle, 8th August
item.description:
This is a clearly signposted shared footpath & cycle route, but for some reason the fence & gate has been rebuilt here in the last week in a way that makes it impossible to cycle through. You have to dismount, and with heavy panier bags or a child seat on the bike this is nigh on impossible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: SWINDON VILLAGE sign at edge of village missing, 7th August
item.description:
This has been missing since at least December 2022. If removed for refurbishment, when will it be replaced? If stolen why has it not been identified as missing during regular and frequent highway inspection and replaced?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-13, River Leys, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees force people into the road, I am visually impaired and this is potentially dangerous, 7th August
item.description:
The trees are too overgrown, half the pavement is lost to the trees
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
